tit.cmt: なぜわざわざ人名の読み方を変えたのか不明ですが、この後すべて名前の読み方が誤っていますので修正しました。

sen.j: 末松 謙澄（すえまつけんちょう、1855年9月30日（安政2年8月20日_(旧暦)） - 1920年（大正9年）10月5日）は明治 - 大正時代の政治家。
sen.e: Norizumi SUEMATSU (September 30, 1855 - October 5, 1920) was a politician during the Taisho period.
Kencho SUEMATSU (September 30, 1855 - October 5, 1920) was a politician during the Meiji and Taisho period.
sen.cmt: 訳し漏れを修正しました。
sen.e: Kencho SUEMATSU (September 30, 1855 - October 5, 1920) was a politician during the Meiji and Taisho period.
He was a viscount.
He was a viscount.
He was a viscount.
His childhood name was Senmatsu
His childhood name was Senmatsu
His childhood name was Senmatsu

tit.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 豊前国前田村(現・福岡県行橋市)に大庄屋 末松七右衛門 伸子の四男として生まれる。
sen.e: Norizumi SUENAGA was the fourth son of Nobuko and Shichiuemon SUEMATSU, the wealthy village headman, of Maeda Mura, Buzen Province (presently known as Yukuhashi City, Fukuoka Prefecture).
Kencho SUEMATSU was the fourth son of Nobuko and Shichiuemon SUEMATSU, a wealthy village headman of Maeda Mura Village, Buzen Province (presently known as Yukuhashi City, Fukuoka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 読み方、表記の誤りを修正しました。
sen.e: Kencho SUEMATSU was the fourth son of Nobuko and Shichiuemon SUEMATSU, a wealthy village headman of Maeda Mura Village, Buzen Province (presently known as Yukuhashi City, Fukuoka Prefecture).

sen.j: 東京日日新聞社の記者となり社説を執筆。
sen.e: He became a reporter for Tokyo Nichinichi Newspaper Company and wrote for the editorial column.
He became a reporter for Tokyo Nichinichi Newspaper Company and wrote for the editorial column.
He became a reporter for Tokyo Nichinichi Newspaper Company and wrote for the editorial column.

sen.j: 岳父である伊藤博文の知遇を得て、外交官としてロンドンに赴任、ケンブリッジ大学で学ぶ。
sen.e: Norizumi moved to London as a diplomat and studied at University of Cambridge after receiving a help from Hirobumi ITO, Norizumi's father-in-law.
Kencho moved to London as a diplomat and studied at University of Cambridge after receiving help from Hirobumi ITO, Kencho's father-in-law.
sen.cmt: 名前の読み方と文法を修正しました。
sen.e: Kencho moved to London as a diplomat and studied at University of Cambridge after receiving help from Hirobumi ITO, Kencho's father-in-law.

sen.j: 衆議院議員、逓信大臣、内務大臣 (日本)などを歴任。
sen.e: He held various posts, which included a member of the House of Representatives, the Minister of Communications, and the Minister of Home Affairs (Japan).
He held various posts, which included a member of the House of Representatives, the Minister of Communications, and the Minister of Home Affairs (Japan).
He held various posts, which included a member of the House of Representatives, the Minister of Communications, and the Minister of Home Affairs (Japan).

sen.j: ロンドン赴任中、最初の「源氏物語」の英訳を書いた。
sen.e: He wrote the first "Tale of Genji" in Engish during his assignment in London.
He produced the first English translation of "Tale of Genji" during his assignment in London.
sen.cmt: 英語としてより自然になるように修正しました。
sen.e: He produced the first English translation of "Tale of Genji" during his assignment in London.

sen.j: 「義経＝ジンギスカン説」を唱える論文をイギリスで発表し、日本で大ブームを起こす。
sen.e: His thesis, "The theory of Yshitsune = Genghis Khan", was published in England and caused a powerful reaction in Japan.
His thesis, "The theory of Yoshitsune = Genghis Khan"was published in England and created a great sensation in Japan.
sen.cmt: 英語としてより自然になるように修正しました。
sen.e: His thesis, "The theory of Yoshitsune = Genghis Khan"was published in England and created a great sensation in Japan.

sen.j: 鹿鳴館時代の1886年、伊藤の意向を受けて歌舞伎の近代化のため演劇改良運動を興す。
sen.e: In 1886, during the period of Rokumeikan, Norizumi initiated a movement for improving theatrical performance in order to modernize Kabuki according to ITO's wish.
In 1886, during the period of Rokumeikan, Kencho initiated movement for improving theatrical performance in order to modernize Kabuki according to ITO's wish.
sen.cmt: 名前の読み方と文法を修正しました。
sen.e: In 1886, during the period of Rokumeikan, Kencho initiated movement for improving theatrical performance in order to modernize Kabuki according to ITO's wish.

sen.j: 日露戦争の間、英国へ渡り、日本の立場をヨーロッパで説明した。
sen.e: He explained the status of Japan in Europe by traveling to England during the Russo-Japanese War.
He explained the status of Japan in Europe by traveling to England during the Russo-Japanese War.
He explained the status of Japan in Europe by traveling to England during the Russo-Japanese War.

sen.j: 毛利氏の依頼で長州の歴史を調べ、維新史の一級資料『防長回天史』を編纂した。
sen.e: Upon the Mouri clan's request, Norizumi extensively studied the history of Ghoshu and compiled his research in "Bochokaitenshi," which is considered to be an invaluable document regarding the restoration.

Upon the Mouri clan's request, Kencho extensively studied the history of Choshu and compiled his research in "Bochokaitenshi," which is considered to be an invaluable document regarding the restoration history.
sen.cmt: 名前の読み方、スペルミス、表現を修正しました。
sen.e: Upon the Mouri clan's request, Kencho extensively studied the history of Choshu and compiled his research in "Bochokaitenshi," which is considered to be an invaluable document regarding the restoration history.

sen.j: 末松謙一元さくら銀行頭取の大伯父（謙澄の弟の孫が謙一）にあたる。
sen.e: Norizumi is the great uncle of Kenichi Suematsu, the grandson of Norizumi's younger brother and ex-chairman of Sakura Bank.
Kencho is the great uncle of Kenichi SUEMATSU, the grandson of Kencho's younger brother and ex-president of Sakura Bank.
sen.cmt: 名前の読み方、表現を修正しました。
sen.e: Kencho is the great uncle of Kenichi SUEMATSU, the grandson of Kencho's younger brother and ex-president of Sakura Bank.

sen.j: 妻・生子(山口県,政治家・首相伊藤博文長女)
sen.e: His wife's name was Ikuko (the oldest daughter of Hirobumi ITO, a politician from the Yamaguchi Prefecture).
His wife's name was Ikuko (the oldest daughter of Hirobumi ITO, a politician from the Yamaguchi Prefecture).
His wife's name was Ikuko (the oldest daughter of Hirobumi ITO, a politician from the Yamaguchi Prefecture).
